root: ^Fifteen years I’ve been cleaning the trash out of this pit
^and no matter what I do it keeps coming back!
^You're a rare sight around this part of Everest.
^If you food, you're mostly out of luck.
^Not many things to eat aroudn here.
^But I did find a piece of bamboo earlier.
^You're welcome to have it if you'd like.

s: ^Thank you so much! I was starving, I didn’t know if I was going to make it much longer
^Thank you, spirit. I appreciate the kindness.

c-1: ^But I have to ask, why take pity on me of all animals?

O1: ^The last thing I want to have happen is to watch another species of the mountain go extinct.
^That’s why I’m still here, picking up trash.
^I don’t think my spirit will be allowed to leave this place until I completely clean Everest.
^I’ve been here fifteen years now, and I don’t feel like I’ve even scratched the surface.
I1: ^It’s not pity, it’s out of perseverance.
^My spirit may be stuck here to clean trash off the mountain,
^but my purpose is to preserve its ecosystem.
S1: ^I’m going to pretend you didn’t just say that
^You spend fifteen years cleaning a mountain so animals like you have a safe place to live.
^And this is what I’m rewarded with.

s: ^Sounds like a problem for you, not for me.

c-0: ^If there’s anything I can do to help before I continue to the mountain's summit
^then I’d love to do what I can.
c-1: ^I have to continue to the summit.
c-2: ^I’m gonna be on my way now.
^Still have a long way to go until I reach the summit.

O2: ^Normally I’d be happy to do it without anything in return
^but I’m simply not able to clean up this mountain on my own.
^If you could collect some trash and bring it to me then I would be most appreciative.
^Three pieces would be more than enough.
^I may even be able to help you summit the mountain.
I2: ^I’m not even sure if your species can make it that far due to the lack of oxygen.
^I think I can help with that problem.
^If that's what you wish to do, then I won’t stop you.
^I may even be able to help,
^I can’t clean this mountain on my own,
^and the amount of trash that keeps piling up here only seems to grow,
^no matter how much of it I remove.
^If you can bring me three pieces of trash,
^then I’ll help you on your journey to the top.
S2: ^Wouldn’t know how to be thankful if your life depended on it.
^Normally I'd tell you to buzz off.
^I heard you saying you’re trying to reach the top of the mountain, right?
^I've trying to clean this place for years,
^but the amount of trash that keeps piling up only seems to grow.
^But, I think I may have a solution to both our problems
^If you can bring me three pieces of trash, then I’ll help you on your journey to the top.
^I promise you, you won't make it much farther without what I have to offer.

s: ^Of course! It’s only fair I return the favor.
^I told myself I wouldn’t stop until I’ve reached the top,

c-0: ^I’ll be back once I’ve collected the three pieces of trash you’ve asked for.
c-1: ^but you’ve been kind to me so it’s only fair I be kind to you.
^Plus I am certainly not going to turn down help in reaching the summit.
c-2: ^Well that’s what I'd like to say.
^But you seem like a gullible spirit
^so I’m sure I will actually need your help.
^I’ll find your trash for you, but the reward better not be a waste of my time.
